channel.title: Time Series on Kejin Wu
channel.description: Recent content in Time Series on Kejin Wu

item.title: Bootstrap prediction inference of nonlinear autoregressive models
item.description: This paper applies a so-called Molde-free prediction method—NoVaS—to do volatility forecasting of financial series. We develop a more parsimonious variant of the existing method. With systematic justification and extensive data analysis, we verify its great performance on long-term time aggregated predictions.

item.title: Multi-Step-Ahead prediction intervals for nonparametric autoregressions via Bootstrap: consistency, debiasing, and pertinence
item.description: This paper applies a so-called Molde-free prediction method—NoVaS—to do volatility forecasting of financial series. We develop a more parsimonious variant of the existing method. With systematic justification and extensive data analysis, we verify its great performance on long-term time aggregated predictions.

item.title: A model-free approach to do long-term volatility forecasting and its variants
item.description: This paper applies a so-called Molde-free prediction method—NoVaS—to do volatility forecasting of financial series. We develop a more parsimonious variant of the existing method. With systematic justification and extensive data analysis, we verify its great performance on long-term time aggregated predictions.

item.title: Model-free time-aggregated predictions for econometric datasets
item.description: This paper applies a so-called Molde-free prediction method—NoVaS—to do volatility forecasting of financial series. We develop a more parsimonious variant of the existing method. With systematic justification and extensive data analysis, we verify its great performance on long-term time aggregated predictions. (This is my first paper with Professor Karmakar. Thanks for his guidance!)
